input:
The doorbell rang.
(1)The visitor tapped the knocker on the door.(2)The woman peered through the keyhole in the door.

I vacuumed the carpet.
(1)My roommate spilled punch.(2)My dog shed hair.

My office door was open.
(1)I talked to my colleague at my desk.(2)I overheard the conversation in the hall.

The laptop wouldn't turn on.
(1)I dropped it.(2)I charged it.

My friend was recovering from surgery.
(1)I dropped her off at the hospital.(2)I brought her a card and flowers.

The man looked at his watch.
(1)He realized he forgot something.(2)He realized he was early.

I clenched the candy wrapper in my fist.
(1)The wrapper crinkled.(2)The wrapper ripped.

The man removed his coat.
(1)He entered the house.(2)He loosened his tie.

The man made an error in his calculations.
(1)He checked his work.(2)His work was hasty.

The cashier denied the woman a refund for the dress.
(1)She lost her receipt.(2)The dress didn't fit.

I drilled a hole in the wall.
(1)A mouse crawled out of the hole.(2)Dust blew out of the hole.

The tree branch landed in the river.
(1)The branch moved downstream.(2)The river's current became stronger.

The girl's hands became blistered.
(1)She typed up a letter.(2)She climbed up a rope.

It got dark outside.
(1)Snowflakes began to fall from the sky.(2)The moon became visible in the sky.

I chugged the pitcher of water.
(1)I walked upstairs.(2)I ran five miles.

The player won five games in a row.
(1)Her opponent accused her of cheating.(2)Her opponent felt sorry for her.

The man started an argument with me.
(1)My friend introduced me to the man.(2)My friend stood up for me.

My flight got delayed.
(1)Tornadoes were sighted in the area.(2)I was held up at airport security.

I started a fire in the fireplace.
(1)I was out of firewood.(2)It was cold in the house.

The lights in my friend's apartment were on.
(1)I wondered if he was out.(2)I decided to pay him a visit.

I walked barefoot on the beach.
(1)Sand stuck to my feet.(2)Waves crashed along the shore.

The skunk sprayed the dog.
(1)The dog emitted a foul smell.(2)The skunk roamed the woods.

The woman lingered in the bathtub.
(1)The bathwater became lukewarm.(2)The bathwater drained out of the tub.

The girl yanked the ribbon out of her hair.
(1)She tied the ribbon.(2)The ribbon looked babyish.

I turned the page on the calendar.
(1)I marked an appointment on the calendar.(2)It was the beginning of a new month.

I lit the candle.
(1)Wax dripped off the candle.(2)The wax on the candle hardened.

I felt exhausted.
(1)I slept all day.(2)I studied all day.

The girl found a bug in her cereal.
(1)She poured milk in the bowl.(2)She lost her appetite.

The woman asked the man to leave.
(1)He insulted her.(2)He thanked her.

I pushed the pendulum.
(1)It slowed to a stop.(2)It swung back and forth.

I took the garbage out.
(1)The garbage made the kitchen smell bad.(2)I accidentally threw away my shopping list.

The ship wrecked.
(1)The crew drowned.(2)The crew encountered pirates.

I approached the man.
(1)He looked busy.(2)He looked familiar.

The couple decided to compromise.
(1)They grew tired of arguing.(2)They avoided discussing the problem.

The driver honked her horn.
(1)Another car swerved into her lane.(2)She made a right turn at the light.

The man had an attack of conscience.
(1)He manipulated his friend.(2)He admitted his indiscretion.

I excused myself from the group.
(1)I turned off my phone.(2)My phone rang.

I put coins in the washing machine at the laundromat.
(1)The machine powered on.(2)I ran out of laundry detergent.

The leader antagonized the extremists among his country.
(1)The extremists influenced him.(2)The extremists assassinated him.

The girl met her favorite actor.
(1)She went to see his new film.(2)She asked him for his autograph.

The customer came into the boutique.
(1)She left her wallet at home.(2)The window display caught her eye.

The photographer got the child to smile.
(1)The photographer quickly snapped the child's photo.(2)The photographer quickly changed the child's pose.

The writer missed her deadline for the draft submission.
(1)She had writer's block.(2)She edited the draft.

The politician lost the election.
(1)He ran negative campaign ads.(2)No one voted for him.

The woman was arrested.
(1)She checked into rehab.(2)She committed assault.

The boy's hands were shaking.
(1)He planned to ask the girl out.(2)His palms were cold and sweaty.

The man drank water with his meal.
(1)His meal was cold.(2)His meal was spicy.

The researchers proved the theory.
(1)The researchers retracted the theory.(2)Individuals accepted the theory.

The woman was summoned for jury duty.
(1)She contacted her lawyer.(2)She cancelled her appointments.

I wiped my hands with a towel.
(1)The towel was wet.(2)My hands were wet.

The trip took a long time.
(1) The driver talked the whole way.(2)The driver made a wrong turn.

They travelers checked into their hotel room.
(1)They unpacked their suitcases.(2)They went to the airport.

The student tried to do the math in his head.
(1)He got out a calculator.(2)He got confused.

The documents contained important information.
(1)I paper clipped them together.(2)I kept them in a secure place.

The competition ended.
(1)The teams got pumped up.(2)The teams shook hands.

I bought my mother a present.
(1)I baked her a cake.(2)It was her birthday.

The community learned of the man's death.
(1)His family buried him in the cemetery.(2)His obituary appeared in the newspaper.

The boy pushed his sister.
(1)His sister tattled on him.(2)They played hide and seek.

The physician diagnosed the patient.
(1)She identified the patient's symptoms.(2)She prescribed pills to the patient.

I encountered an old friend.
(1)I revealed a secret to him.(2)I gave him a hug.

The girl whispered back and forth to each other at the lunch table.
(1)Other students sat down at the lunch table.(2)Other students at the lunch table felt left out.
